JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON and PERSON , former Representatives of GPE at ORG

In DATE a housing construction cooperative , ORG , ( “ the cooperative ” ) was set up within FAC in GPE . Its aim was to construct a new residential building with a view to improving the staff 's housing conditions . ORG had provided the cooperative with a plot of land in GPE for construction . Under a finance contract of DATE , the construction was to be funded firstly by contributions from members of the cooperative ( “ share allocations ” ) and secondly by a private company , PERSON , which would receive in exchange flats , other LOC of a total surface area of CARDINAL sq.m , parking and a building of a total surface area of CARDINAL sq.m on this plot of land . The share allocation to be paid by the members of the cooperative was determined in accordance with the surface area of the flats that they would receive , which , taken together with the investment share that Stroyservice-CARDINAL would allocate to each of them ought to correspond to the balance cost of their flats . This finance plan , and the division of residential area and office premises between the cooperative and PERSON , were endorsed on CARDINAL DATE by ORG .

The applicant had joined the cooperative on DATE on a decision by a general meeting of members . On DATE she signed an employment contract with the cooperative 's administration and began working as its chief accountant . Under LAW of a supplementary agreement to this contract , signed on DATE , the chief accountant , who was at the same time a member of the cooperative , would receive a CARDINAL - roomed flat which she would choose herself at the close of the construction work , prior to the general drawing of lots . On DATE the applicant also became a member of the cooperative 's governing body .

By decisions of the general meeting of members of CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE , the amount of the share allocation for CARDINAL - roomed flats was set at MONEY ( RUB ) ( MONEY CARDINAL ) . In DATE the applicant paid the cooperative her joining fee and the share allocation for a CARDINAL - roomed flat . In total she paid RUB CARDINAL .

On completion of the work , a general drawing of lots was held on DATE for the purpose of attributing flats to the members of the cooperative . As envisaged in her contract , the applicant was entitled to choose her flat before this draw was made . On DATE she chose flat no . CARDINAL . According to the minutes of the governing board 's meeting of CARDINAL DATE , it was noted that the applicant and certain other individuals , referred to as contractual members , were performing their duties within the cooperative appropriately and that , in consequence , their choice of flats should be endorsed . The applicant 's choice was thus approved unanimously . The general meeting of members on DATE confirmed that flat no . CARDINAL had been attributed to the applicant , and this fact was entered by hand in her membership book and signed by the director of the cooperative . The cooperative 's management sent the documents confirming the distribution of flats to ORG to obtain property title certificates .

From DATE the members of the cooperative , including the applicant , began moving into their flats . By Act No . CARDINAL of DATE and a project completion certificate of DATE , signed by the cooperative and ORG , it was recognised that each party had fulfilled the financial commitments entered into , and that out of CARDINAL flats , whose construction was jointly financed by PERSON and the cooperative , the latter received QUANTITY flats , including flat no . CARDINAL .

By a decision of DATE the governing body decided to appoint an acting chief accountant for the duration of the applicant 's sick leave . On an unspecified date in DATE the applicant was dismissed from this post .

According to the applicant , having paid the cooperative the full amount of her share allocation , in accordance with LAW of GPE , she became the owner of her flat . However , the cooperative refused to issue her with a certificate confirming that she had paid her share allocation in full . The applicant brought legal proceedings against the cooperative .

On DATE the members of the cooperative held a general meeting and , in view of their dissatisfaction with the governing board in place , elected a new management team , headed by a new director . As the cooperative 's documents and other symbols remained in the hands of the members of the outgoing governing board , the new director ordered a new official stamp for the cooperative .

On CARDINAL DATE the ORG of GPE ( Тверской межмуниципальный народный суд г. GPE ) , having examined the documents submitted by the applicant , considered it proven that the applicant had fully honoured her financial obligations as a member of the cooperative , and ordered the latter to issue her with a certificate confirming that her share allocation had been paid in full . This judgment was not appealed against and became final .

In compliance with this judgment , on DATE the applicant was issued with the certificate in question , which bore the cooperative 's new stamp . According to this document , on DATE the applicant had paid her share allocation in full , namely RUB CARDINAL , for a CARDINAL - roomed flat no . CARDINAL , the balance value of which was RUB MONEY , the difference between the CARDINAL amounts having been financed in accordance with the finance plan of CARDINAL DATE ( that is by the investor , PERSON ) .
On the basis of this document , on DATE the applicant had her property title to flat no . CARDINAL registered with the municipal housing department at ORG .
It appears from the other decisions issued in this case that , by a judgment of DATE , ORG of GPE declared the cooperative 's new stamp null and void . The grounds for this decision remain unknown .

On DATE the general meeting decided to exclude the applicant from the cooperative on the ground that she had not performed her duties as an accountant appropriately . Noting also that the applicant had not paid the first instalment of her share allocation on time and that she had not paid the subsequent instalment of DATE , the meeting decided , in addition to her dismissal , to deprive her of her property right to the cooperative 's flat .

The applicant challenged her exclusion from the cooperative before the domestic courts . The cooperative filed a counter - claim requesting to have it established that she had never been a member . In support of this request , the cooperative submitted that TIME of the general meeting of DATE , confirming the applicant 's membership , contained inaccurate information

On DATE ORG of GPE overturned the decision to exclude the applicant from the cooperative and dismissed the latter 's counter - claim . As regards the counter - claim the court noted that the participants at this general meeting had confirmed before it that the applicant had indeed been admitted as a member on DATE . In addition , on DATE the general meeting , the only body with authority to decide on membership , re - examined the list of members in the light of each individual 's compliance with his or her financial obligations , and confirmed the applicant 's membership . It further found that , if the applicant had not been a member , she would not have received on CARDINAL DATE the membership book that the cooperative issued solely to its members .

On the basis of the receipts , the membership book and other information obtained from the bank , the court established that the applicant had paid all of the instalments of her share allocation , for a total amount of RUB CARDINAL , but that she had not paid RUB CARDINAL , a financial contribution decided on at the general meeting of CARDINAL DATE , and RUB CARDINAL , a sum imposed for various administrative costs . The court considered that a failure to pay the “ extremely modest ” sum of RUB MONEY could not justify a member 's exclusion from the cooperative , especially as the latter had submitted no evidence of a proposition to the applicant to pay this sum and her refusal to pay .
The decision to exclude the applicant was therefore held to be null and void and the court ordered that she be reinstated as a member .
In DATE the ORG 's management brought an action before ORG of GPE in order to have the applicant 's ownership certificate to the flat no . CARDINAL of DATE declared illegal .

In particular , the cooperative alleged that on DATE the applicant 's membership had been approved by the general meeting subject to the condition that she performed , on a contractual basis , the duties of chief accountant . It was in exchange for employment as an accountant that the cooperative had undertaken to allocate her a CARDINAL - roomed flat . Abusing this position , the applicant had unlawfully fabricated a document confirming that her share allocation had been paid in full and , with the help of this document , she had obtained the ownership certificate of DATE .
Called to the court as a third party , the municipal housing department of ORG maintained that the disputed ownership certificate was legal .

By a judgment of DATE , the court found that the applicant had joined the cooperative as a contractual member and that on CARDINAL DATE she had signed a mutual cooperation contract with the management . Her obligation to perform the duties of chief accountant in exchange for her membership status had been reiterated in the supplementary agreement of DATE . The court established that in accordance with the cooperative 's statute , which made a distinction between ordinary members and contractual members , the ORG 's management would have been entitled to refuse to allocate a flat to a contractual member if he or she failed to perform the duties set out in the relevant employment contract . In consequence , the court dismissed the applicant 's arguments that she had fulfilled the contract signed with the cooperative and therefore had been already provided with the disputed flat . It established that failure to comply with the contract 's clauses had direct repercussions on her status as a member and on her rights and obligations with regard to the flat . Having referred to various audit reports , the opinion of the supervisory committee and the court - appointed expert 's report of DATE , the court found that the applicant had not fulfilled her contractual obligations towards the cooperative in an appropriate manner .

The court further found that the decision of the general meeting of CARDINAL DATE merely endorsed the results of the draw and in no way proved that the applicant had received flat no . CARDINAL independently of her employment obligations within the cooperative . The governing board 's meeting of CARDINAL DATE made only a preliminary allocation of the flats on a condition of fulfilment by the cooperative 's members of their obligations , as the building in question had not been yet put into service , therefore this decision could not be regarded as providing the applicant with a flat .

Furthermore , in addition to the RUB CARDINAL non - payment which had been established by the judgment of DATE , the applicant had failed to pay to the cooperative the book value of the apartment , equivalent to RUB CARDINAL . The court dismissed the applicant 's arguments that by a decision of the general meeting the share allocation for a CARDINAL - roomed flat had been set at RUB CARDINAL , that she had paid this amount in full as confirmed by the same judgment of DATE , and that the remaining amount had been funded by Stroyservice-CARDINAL in accordance with the funding plan of CARDINAL DATE . It noted that the applicant was not included in the list of the cooperative 's members whose shares had been compensated by the above company .

The court also mentioned that the cooperative 's stamp on the certificate of DATE confirming the applicant 's title to flat no . CARDINAL and on the certificate of DATE confirming that the applicant had paid her allocation in full had been declared null and void . The applicant 's argument that the certificates were issued on the basis of the court judgment of CARDINAL DATE was dismissed on the ground that this judgment did not include the amount of the allocation paid by the applicant .
The ownership certificate of DATE was thus declared null and void . Both the applicant and her lawyer had participated in the hearing .

On DATE ORG , having heard the applicant 's lawyer , dismissed the applicant 's appeal , having mentioned that the applicant had not been compensated by the investor and that the cooperative 's stamp on the certificates of DATE and DATE had been declared null and void .
On DATE and CARDINAL DATE judges of ORG of GPE rejected the applicant 's requests for a supervisory review .

On DATE CARDINAL members of the cooperative lodged a complaint with the department of ORG LOC , alleging organised crime within the cooperative 's management . They complained that at various points DATE the cooperative 's managers , in criminal agreement with PERSON , had led CARDINAL members of the cooperative to believe that the latter had a debt towards Stroyservice-CARDINAL , which would no longer pay the individual investment shares for the members of the cooperative . These members were thus obliged to pay considerable sums in cash , with no receipts , as supplementary contributions . The complainants noted in this respect that criminal proceedings had been brought against Stroyservice-CARDINAL but that the case had been discontinued on DATE . In addition , in order to acquire the flats for itself with a view to their resale , the cooperative had brought unfounded judicial proceedings against various members of the cooperative . Having paid their share allocations as defined by the general meeting in full , those members found themselves accused of failing to pay the sums necessary to cover the cooperative 's non - existent debt to Stroyservice-CARDINAL . In other cases , members were accused of failing to pay the individual investment shares which , under the terms of the construction finance plan , PERSON had undertaken to pay . Finally , the claimants pointed out that the director of the cooperative had not convened a general meeting since DATE .

On DATE the municipal housing department of ORG wrote to ORG , setting out the facts as these had been brought to its attention following CARDINAL sets of proceedings opposing the cooperative and its members , in which it had been called upon to take part as a defendant or CARDINAL party .

According to ORG , the cooperative director whose DATE term of office had expired in DATE had falsified documents attesting untrue facts and used them to the detriment of the members of the cooperative . According to those documents , PERSON had invested more money than planned in the construction work and the cooperative was consequently indebted towards it . As a result , the members of the cooperative had to pay this debt , which amounted to MONEY . In reality , this additional investment had never existed . The department submitted that , as victims of this abuse of power , the members of the cooperative had been deprived of their possessions and that multiple proceedings were being brought before the courts in this connection . It requested the prosecutor 's office to examine the question of criminal proceedings against the director of the cooperative .
No information had been provided by the parties with respect to the further course of the investigation .

Article CARDINAL of LAW of the RSFSR , which was in force at the material time , provides that that a person who has become a member of a cooperative on the basis of a decision by a general meeting of that cooperative is to receive a flat with a surface area calculated in relation to the number of persons in his or her family and in relation to the amount of his or her share allocation .
In accordance with LAW of GPE , title to a property , public registration of which is required by law , takes effect at the time that title is registered .
Under LAW of LAW , a member of a housing construction cooperative may acquire title to the property in question after paying in full the share allocation for a flat .
